Border Styles

Border styles are applied with .bor-* by default and there's quite a few options depending on which coordinate and style you want.

Any class prefix and value is customisable so you can have the css code that suits your coding style.

Usage

Basic

Basic border styles are just applying a uniform, solid border style to every edge of the element. The color of the border is inherited from the font color.

.bor-0
.bor-1
.bor-2
.bor-3
.bor-5
<span class="bor-0"> has no border    </span>
<span class="bor-1"> has a 1px border </span>
<span class="bor-3"> has a 3px border </span>

Styles

.bor-2
.bor-2dot
.bor-2dash
<span class="bor-2">     solid border  </span>
<span class="bor-2dot">  dotted border </span>
<span class="bor-2dash"> dashed border </span>

Coordinates

.bor-3
.bor-l3
.bor-t3
.bor-b3
.bor-r3
<span class="bor-3">  full border   </span>
<span class="bor-l3"> left border   </span>
<span class="bor-r3"> right border  </span>
<span class="bor-t3"> top border    </span>
<span class="bor-b3"> bottom border </span>

Combined

.bor-t3
.bor-t3dot
.bor-t3dash
<span class="bor-t3">     top border, 3px, solid   </span>
<span class="bor-t3dot">  top border, 3px, dotted  </span>
<span class="bor-t3dash"> top border, 3px, dashed  </span>

Media Queries

Border styles are supported across breakpoints by supplying the prefixes defined (default: tb, dt) to target screen sizes. (see the media query section for details)

<table class="bor-1 tb-bor-t3 tb-bor-b3 dt-bor-l5 dt-bor-r5">
    Table has:
        - 1px border
        - 3px top/bottom border on tablet+
        - 5px left/right border on desktop+
</table>

Customising

Default Classes

The default class prefix can be changed by supplying a $border-style-prop variable.

// change the class prefix to .b-
$border-style-prop: "b-";

Custom Coordinates

The directions/coordinates that css is generated for can be customised by supplying a custom border-style-coords map.

// only generate top/left/all borders
// with a different prefix
$border-style-coords: (
  a: "",
  t: "top",
  l: "left"
);

Custom Styles

Another property that can be customised is the border-style, which is achieved by providing an override map for $border-styles.

// only supply solid and dotted
// border styles.
$border-styles: (
  "s": solid,
  "d": dotted
);

Custom Sizes

Lastly the sizes of the borders can also be supplied with a custom $border-sizes map.

// we just want 1px and 10px borders
$border-sizes: (
  "1":  1px,
  "10": 10px
);

Combined

After changing the prefix property and the map of radii in the previous two customisations, we would end up with the following css.

/* would result in css like: */
.b-a0     { border: none; }
.b-a1s    { border: 1px solid; }
.b-a1d    { border: 1px dotted; }
.b-a10s   { border: 10px solid; }
.b-a10d   { border: 10px dotted; }

.b-t0     { border-top: none; }
.b-t1s    { border-top: 1px solid; }
.b-t1d    { border-top: 1px dotted; }
.b-t10s   { border-top: 10px solid; }
.b-t10d   { border-top: 10px dotted; }

.b-l0     { border-left: none; }
.b-l1s    { border-left: 1px solid; }
.b-l1d    { border-left: 1px dotted; }
.b-l10s   { border-left: 10px solid; }
.b-l10d   { border-left: 10px dotted; }

view the source on github: /src/components/border/_style.scss
